H0.text: What is the word for the process of using strong acid or mordant to cut into the unprotected parts of a metal surface to create a design in intaglio in the metal. Engraver

H1.text: What is the word for the process of using strong acid or mordant to cut into the unprotected parts of a metal surface to create a design in intaglio in the metal. Acidographer

H2.text: What is the word for the process of using strong acid or mordant to cut into the unprotected parts of a metal surface to create a design in intaglio in the metal. Intagliator

H3.text: What is the word for the process of using strong acid or mordant to cut into the unprotected parts of a metal surface to create a design in intaglio in the metal. Etcher

A4.text: Etching is traditionally the process of using strong acid or mordant to cut into the unprotected parts of a metal surface to create a design in intaglio (incised) in the metal.

A5.text: As a method of printmaking, it is, along with engraving, the most important technique for old master prints, and remains in wide use today.

A6.text: Prints & People: A Social History of Printed Pictures, an exhibition catalog from The Metropolitan Museum of Art, which contains material on etching.

A7.text: Etching from the MMA Timeline of Art History
